description.hltext_display: Don't be afraid to try a standing rib roast -- we have the secrets
description.author: darrington@sacbee.com (Debbie Arrington
description.content:
The secret to the perfect prime rib? Try plenty of mustard, rock salt � and a roll of masking tape.
The tape is for securing the oven door to keep nosy guests from checking out the main course � and letting the essential heat out. It's a reminder to the cook, too: Don't peek!
The salt-crust method of cooking prime rib � coating the meat with rock salt and putting it in a super-hot oven, then turning the heat off and letting the retained warmth roast the meat to perfection � is regaining popularity as home cooks tackle this familiar Christmas and New Year's favorite.
"Salt-crusted prime rib is making a comeback," said butcher Danny Johnson, who owns Taylor's Market on Freeport Boulevard in Sacramento. "A lot of people are going back to that method. It seals in all the juices. It's a wonderful way to make prime rib."
There are other wonderful ways, resulting in roasts that are just as tasty and rib-sticking good. (You'll find recipes on Page D2.)
On this meaty topic, Johnson can pick bones with anyone. This month, his specialty market will sell tons of prime rib � between 4,000 and 5,000 pounds � for holiday dinners.
The high price of the beef keeps many cooks from attempting prime rib at home � they fear it's just too expensive to get wrong. But industry surveys and meat-market sales show that more people are willing to take the risk for a special meal.
At $11.99 to $16.99 a pound, a full seven-rib roast of dry-aged prime rib can cost $250 to $340.
"It's a top seller in December," Johnson said. "At those prices, there's always a little sticker shock. But take 10 to 12 people out for a prime rib dinner at a nice restaurant � then you'll get real sticker shock. Making it at home is more economical."
Americans' heartier appetite for home-cooked prime rib reflects several trends. We're eating out less and cooking more. We crave comfort food and traditional favorites. We watch professional chefs on the Food Network and the Cooking Channel. We're convinced: We really can do this at home.
Two years ago, Food Network superstar Tyler Florence of Mill Valley demonstrated prime rib on his "Christmas Made Easy" holiday episode of "How To Boil Water." (The episode can be seen online at www.foodnetwork.com.)
That was enough for Linda Knowles of Roseville. She has been cooking her own prime rib roast for the holidays ever since.
"I saw Tyler Florence make it on the Food Network, and it seemed so simple," Knowles said. "It just made you want to eat it � with the horseradish, scalloped potatoes and Yorkshire pudding. When I tried it, it all turned out so good."
Why prime rib for Christmas? "It's roast beef, an English tradition," Knowles said. "My family is originally from the British Isles. And it's just so satisfying."
A guest doesn't have to have an English heritage to appreciate a good rib roast. The appeal is more universal than that. "During the holidays, it's an indulgent special treat," Johnson said.
There's also a limited supply, he noted. "Each steer only has two."
Also called standing rib roast, a full prime rib roast � weighing 15 to 20 pounds � represents the sixth through 12th rib on either side of the steer. That roast can be cut down into pieces, measured by the number of bones.
"A one-bone prime rib is basically a really thick ribeye steak," Johnson said. "So get at least two bones."
To properly age his prime rib, Johnson built a special meat locker at Taylor's. At 34 degrees, the beef is hung for 21 to 28 days. That allows enzymes to naturally tenderize the muscle.
His No. 1 rule: "Don't overcook it!"
"It continues to cook while it rests (after roasting). It's very important to pull it out of the oven early, 10 degrees before the temperature you want. That will keep it pink, tender and juicy all the way through."
A primer on prime rib � How much meat do you buy? A full prime rib roast has seven bones and weighs 15 to 20 pounds. To calculate the size needed for a dinner party, figure one rib for every two people or 1 pound per person. A two-rib roast typically weighs about 5 pounds and will serve four hungry guests. � Before roasting: Remove the meat from the refrigerator for two to four hours before roasting to let it reach room temperature. With cooking twine or string, tie the roast at both ends between the bones (for large roasts, tie it a couple of times in the middle, too). This will keep the meat from pulling apart from the bones during cooking. � Cooking time: Usually 15 to 18 minutes per pound. A two-rib roast cooks in 60 to 70 minutes plus rest time; a seven-rib roast, 3 to 4 hours plus rest time. � Temperature: Use a meat thermometer (either instant-read or stay-in-roast) stuck in the center of the meat. For rare, the roast will reach 120 degrees; medium rare, 130 degrees; medium, 140 degrees; medium well, 150 degrees; well done, 160 degrees.
Note: Prime rib keeps cooking after it's removed from the oven. So pull the roast out before it reaches the optimum temperature for desired doneness, then let it rest 20 minutes. The temperature will rise 10 degrees in that time. For example, for medium rare, pull the roast out at 120 degrees and carve after a 20-minute wait. The finished roast will be at 130 degrees.
A PRIME RIB GLOSSARY
Chine bones: Also called feather bones, these run along the base of the roast and hold the ribs together.
Cradled: The rib bones are cut away from the meat, then tied back on; the ribs form a cradle for the roast.
Dry aged: The roast is cut fresh and hung in a low-humidity, low-temperature environment to age; this process naturally tenderizes the meat.
Eye: The meat encircled by the rib bones; that's the cut used for ribeye steak.
Frenched: The tips of the rib bones are trimmed of meat and exposed for a classic presentation.
Prime: This is the top commercial grade of meat; not all prime rib is prime grade.
Salt crusted: Also called salt jacketed, a traditional method of cooking prime rib; the meat is encrusted with rock or coarse kosher salt (margarita salt works, too), sealing in juices.
Small end: The ribs are cut farther from the shoulder and are smaller; that's a leaner roast with more meat per dollar.
Standing rib roast: The proper name for the cut popularly known as prime rib.
References on the Web
www.foodnetwork.com: Watch how TV chefs such as Tyler Florence make prime rib.
http://baygourmet.tripod.com/primerib.html: The Perfect Prime Rib Page, from Bay Gourmet, including carving tips.

event_or_fact.property: Salt-crusted prime rib is making a comeback; A lot of people are going back to that method. It seals in all the juices. It's a wonderful way to make prime rib.
A one-bone prime rib is basically a really thick ribeye steak; So get at least two bones.

I saw Tyler Florence make it on the Food Network, and it seemed so simple; It just made you want to eat it ? with the horseradish, scalloped potatoes and Yorkshire pudding. When I tried it, it all turned out so good.
During the holidays, it's an indulgent special treat
It's roast beef, an English tradition; My family is originally from the British Isles. And it's just so satisfying.

It's a top seller in December; At those prices, there's always a little sticker shock. But take 10 to 12 people out for a prime rib dinner at a nice restaurant ? then you'll get real sticker shock. Making it at home is more economical.

description.hltext_display: Restaurants and bars Open Christmas Day
description.content:
Christmas is exhausting. This year, why not let someone else sweat glazing the ham, casseroling the green beans and scalloping the potatoes. Here's a list of restaurants that will welcome your lazy, Christmas-weary head on Saturday, Dec. 25, with open arms--and maybe a tall glass of wine.
Restaurants open Christmas day:
Berryhill & Co., 121 N. Ninth St., 208-387-3553, berryhillandco.com. Open for dinner starting at 5 p.m.
Chandlers Steakhouse, 981 W. Grove St., 208-383-4300, chandlersboise.com. Open 4-10 p.m., featuring the regular menu with a few entree specials.
Cottonwood Grille, 913 W. River St., 208-333-9800, cottonwoodgrille.com. Open for dinner starting at 4 p.m. Make a reservation.
Denny's, 2580 Airport Way, 208-344-9092, dennys.com. Open 24 hours a day, seven days a week without any holiday closures.
Flicks, 646 Fulton St., 208-342-4288, theflicksboise.com. Dinner at the cafe and show times starting at 4 p.m. Opening two new movies: I Love You Phillip Morris and The King's Speech.
Kyoto Japanese Steakhouse, 6002 W. Fairview Ave., 208-378-8808. Open 4-10:30 p.m.
Madhuban, 6930 W. State St., 208-853-8215, madhubanindiancuisine.com. Open 11 a.m.-2 p.m. with a FREE lunch buffet.
Modern Hotel, 1314 W. Grove St., 208-424-8244, themodernhotel.com. Open for food and drinks 4 p.m.-midnight.
Murphy's Seafood Bar & Grill, 1555 Broadway Ave., 208-344-3691, cishenanigans.com. Open from noon-8 p.m.
Sa-Wad-Dee Thai, 1890 E. Fairview Ave., Meridian, 208-884-0701, sawaddeethai.com. Open from 11 a.m.-10 p.m. with live music.
Thai Cuisine, 6777 W. Overland Road, 208-658-0516, boisethaicuisine.com. Open noon-10 p.m.
Or maybe you already slogged through Christmas dinner with the fam and want to cap off your evening at a watering hole far, far away from your charades-playing extended cousins. Visit boiseweekly.com for a list of places where wise men and women are willing to pour you a stiff one in Christ's honor.

description.hltext_display: 好調ナポリを警戒するミランＳＤ
description.content: ［Goal.com］ ２０１０年最後のローマ戦で敗北を喫した首位ミランは、ラツィオとナポリに勝ち点差を３ポイントへ詰め寄られている。ミランのアリエド・ブライダＳＤ（スポーツディレクター）は、特にナポリの底力を警戒しているようだ。同ＳＤはイタリア『ラジオＣＲＣ』に対し、次のように語った。「ナポリは本当に強いチームだ。彼らが少しペースを落とすように願っているよ。今の彼らは本当に素晴らしいことをやっているからね。ナポリがリーグのトップクラスにおり、スクデットを争えると感じさせるのは久しぶりのことだ」「今シーズンは、特に夏の補強が当たったチームがタイトルを争っているね。ミランもそうだ。今のナポリは（エディンソン・）カバーニという非常に強力なストライカーを生かせている。今の彼は素晴らしいことをやっているよ」「私は、ナポリが非常に競争力のあるチームで、最後までスクデットを争うと思っているよ」

description.hltext_display: SP leader Azam Khan questions Kashmirâs accession
description.content:
Lucknow: Samajwadi Party leader Mohammad Azam Khan’s remarks on Kashmir have given birth to a new controversy in the state.
Azam Khan, who rejoined the SP recently, created headache for party chief Mulayam Singh after he questioned Kashmir’s accession to India.
In public comments made in Uttar Pradesh's Badaun district, Khan said the UPA government had only one Muslim Cabinet minister - Ghulam Nabi Azad.
The firebrand SP leader further said that Azad was from the Kashmir Valley and "not India", as the dispute over Kashmir being part of India was yet to be resolved.
"Only one Muslim minister is there in the (Union) Cabinet and that too not from India, but from Kashmir. That Kashmir, which is still controversial and we don't know whether that is part of India or not...," Khan was quoted as saying.
Following his controversial statement, political parties are demanding action against the SP leader.
The statement has irked the political parties with the BJP saying that Azam Khan was just trying to create confusion among the Muslims like Digvijay Singh did to garner minority vote bank.
On the other hand, the Congress demanded legal action against the SP leader from the Mayawati government and sought an explanation from party president Mulayam Singh Yadav.
Azam Khan is known for his critical political statements in the past and had even landed in problem for his remarks on the Ambedkar Memorial in Lucknow and calling Bharat Mata as demon.

event_or_fact.property: Only one Muslim minister is there in the (Union) Cabinet and that too not from India, but from Kashmir.; That Kashmir, which is still controversial and we don't know whether that is part of India or not...
the UPA government had only one Muslim Cabinet minister - Ghulam Nabi Azad

description.hltext_display: Bears shift focus toward playoffs
description.author: Andrew Seligman
description.content:
Well, it turns out they are going somewhere. They�re headed back to the playoffs for the first time since their run to the 2007 Super Bowl.
A 40-14 romp outdoors at Minnesota on a cold and snowy Monday night did the trick, giving the Bears (10-4) their third NFC North title in six years. They shook off a brutal beating by New England the previous weekend and snapped a three-year playoff drought with a dominant effort that included Devin Hester�s NFL-record 14th career kick return for a touchdown and three TD passes by Jay Cutler. �This is just one step, it�s one thing we can knock off,� Cutler said. It�s a huge step, one that was hard to envision not too long ago.
The Bears were a mess heading into their bye in late October, with three losses in four games after a 3-0 start. They have since turned things around in a big way.
The win over Minnesota was the sixth in seven games for a team that had appeared to be coming apart at the seams, with Cutler getting battered, the running game being ignored and the blockers providing little protection. Now, they�ll try to lock down a first-round playoff bye in a home game against the New York Jets, and then wrap up the regular season at Green Bay. �This is our first goal of the season: win the division and get in the playoffs,� tight end Greg Olsen said. �Now we�ve got to win out these last two games to give ourselves the best possibility of getting a first-round bye. We�ve got to do our part and get ready for a big-time playoff run.� A win over the Jets on Sunday coupled with a loss by Philadelphia and a loss or tie by the New York Giants would give Chicago a first-round bye. It comes nearly one year after Bears President Ted Phillips issued what many interpreted as a win-or-else mandate for coach Lovie Smith and general manager Jerry Angelo. Chicago had just gone 7-9, and he was adamant: The losing had to stop.
The Bears revamped their coaching staff, hiring Mike Martz as offensive coordinator and promoting Rod Marinelli to defensive coordinator.
They also made a big splash in free agency, signing Pro Bowl defensive end Julius Peppers from Carolina while bringing in running back Chester Taylor and blocking tight end Brandon Manumaleuna.
Peppers is a key reason why the defense has ranked among the league�s best all year. Having Brian Urlacher back at a Pro Bowl level after missing almost all of last year with a wrist injury has helped, too, but the Bears might have been looking at another long offseason had they not made some adjustments. They cut back on the deep drops, started moving Cutler around, and he�s no longer getting brutalized the way he was earlier in the season. They went more to the running game, keeping defenses off balance while reducing wear and tear Cutler.
Against the Vikings, Cutler, who hadn�t led a team to winning record since high school, completed 14 of 24 passes for 194 yards. He had a touchdown catch and 79-yard kickoff return that led to a field goal a few minutes before his game-breaking and record-setting 64-yard punt return. �I�m here today to say that I am a kickoff and punt returner, but at the same time the best to ever do it,� he said.

description.hltext_display: Miami and South Beach, FL Orthodontist Busts Myths Associated With Invisalign
description.content:
BRICKELL, MIAMI AND SOUTH BEACH, FLORIDA - Our staff at the offices of Dr. Stephen Grussmark, a Coral Gables, Brickell, Miami and South Beach, FL orthodontist who owns the Centre for Invisible Orthodontics, encounters plenty of myths about Invisalign as new patients inquire about the invisible orthodontic treatment.
Here are the four most common myths:
Myth 1- Only simple orthodontic cases can be treatment with Invisalign.
Fact- Most malocclusions can be treated with Invisalign alone, or with a combination of Invisalign and traditional braces. In October 2010, Align Technology, Inc., the makers of Invisalign, introduced a series of features that facilitate treatment of Class II (overbite) and Class III (underbite) malocclusions, said Grussmark, a Miami and South Beach, FL Invisalign provider who has offered the treatment since it was introduced in 1999. Even patients requiring complex surgical intervention can be treated with Invisalign.
Myth 2- Invisalign treatment is not as stable as traditional braces.
Fact- Most people will experience movement- particularly in the lower front teeth- as they age if they don’t continue retainer use. There is no scientific evidence of any difference in stability between an Invisalign or braces treated orthodontic case.
Myth 3- Invisalign treatment takes longer than other types of orthodontic treatment.
Fact- Invisalign treatment usually can be completed more quickly than treatment with braces. Average treatment time with Invisalign for our patients is one year.
Myth 4- Invisalign treatment is more expensive than traditional orthodontic treatment.
Fact- Since being introduced in 1999, Grussmark’s Miami and South Beach, FL orthodontics offices have seen the cost of Invisalign treatment decrease by about one third. Today, Invisalign treatment cost is comparable to traditional braces.
Learn More
For more information, or to schedule a complimentary consultation, you can call Dr. Grussmark’s office directly at (305) 670-0263 in Miami or (305) 441-1200 in Coral Gables and Brickell. You also can visit his website: http://www.centerforinvisiblebraces.com/
About Centre for Invisible Orthodontics
The Centre for Invisible Orthodontics is dedicated to orthodontic treatment using Invisalign. Dr. Stephen Grussmark has been an Invisalign provider since 1999. He is an Elite Premier Provider and is among the top 100 Invisalign providers in the world.
Dr. Grussmark earned a bachelor’s degree from University of Florida and attended dental school at University of Maryland. He completed orthodontic residency at Fairleigh Dickinson University and earned a Master of Science in Dentistry degree.
© 2010 SEO services company Sinai Marketing and Dr. Stephen Grussmark. Authorization to post is granted, with the stipulation that Master Google is credited as sole source. Linking to other sites from this press release is strictly prohibited, with the exception of herein imbedded links.

ホッフェンハイムＭＦは来夏にバイエルンへ
description.content: ［Goal.com］ ホッフェンハイムのオーナーであるホップ氏は、ブラジル人ＭＦルイス・グスタヴォが、１０−１１シーズン終了後にバイエルン・ミュンヘンへ移籍することになると認めた。２３歳のＭＦは、今シーズンのブンデスリーガで印象的な活躍を披露しており、バイエルンからの関心が伝えられていた。冬の移籍市場でバイエルンに移籍する可能性もあると伝えられていたが、ホップ氏はシーズン途中でクラブを去ることはないと明らかにした。「ルイス・グスタヴォが次の夏にバイエルンへ移籍することははっきりしている。我々にとってアンフェアなことだろう。モラルに反することでさえあると思うね。移籍を認めなければ、彼のキャリアを台無しにすることになる」とホップ氏は、ドイツ『Ｒｈｅｉｎ−Ｎｅｃｋａｒ−Ｚｅｉｔｕｎｇ』に語ったと伝えられている。「夏の前にグスタヴォが移籍する可能性は低い。彼は我々が十分な後釜を確保したときにのみ、放出される」

description.hltext_display: Hunt, Gather, Gourmet
description.content:
From field to freezer to food with friends
It took most of a year but the freezer full of wild game was worth it. That is until a frozen goose fell out onto my wife's foot. Promptly thereafter, I had a pile of game on my kitchen counter that needed sorting.
Looking it over, I was proud of my accomplishment. I had hunted, brought home meat for my family, even earned some "man points." The wife simply shrugged and pointed at her red swollen toes.
I explained that this kind of local food was the "greenest" food that we had in the house. I told her that we had sustainable, low-impact, locally-sourced, organic and free-range grub that we should hang on to. She nodded in agreement but said that I needed to find something to do with all of the game because "we don't have room for the ice cube trays." (I explained to her that we do not have ice cube trays. She said I was splitting hairs, and I should clean out the freezer.)
Clearly I was not going to be able to keep these frozen trophies forever, so I called a few friends. It was time for a dinner party.
Once I had the concept of a wild-game dinner party in mind, I knew I needed the right beverage accompaniment. Wild game and wine just didn't strike me as the right mix, so I asked my friend Marvin Kinney, owner of Simian Brewing Co., to pair the beers for the evening. Wild Game and beer dinner invitations went out, and there was no lack of interest. Soon 12 adults and six children were confirmed.
The first course was a mixed-game mole. I braised chukar, quail and jackrabbit in a sweet and spicy Mexican sauce made with Iberia chocolate and peanut butter. The braised meat was then removed from the bone, looking a lot like pulled pork.
The jackrabbit took much longer to braise but held up well against the softer, sweeter-tasting game birds. We drank Jane Good Ale, a tropical fruit-forward beer that was a refreshing complement to the spicy mole.
The next course was a venison roulade: back-strap of venison wrapped around venison tenderloin and served with a gratin of local fingerling potatoes. But the meat was over-cooked. I roasted the venison for about 15 minutes too long and ended up with something on its way to jerky. Fortunately, I was able to save it with a homemade elderberry sauce that some friends make and traditionally give out at Christmas. I popped open a jar and added it to my veal gloss, and the sweet and bitter notes of the elderberry saved the dish from being a complete disaster. We paired the venison with a walnut brown ale, Gorillas in the Grist. It's a low-alcohol "small beer" Kinney brewed with the leftovers from his high-alcohol barley wine. The beer was smooth and nutty with hints of caramel that paired well with the sage-seasoned venison. It was definitely my favorite beer of the night.
After the near disaster of the venison, I recovered with an old French staple: baked trout with sauteed leeks, whole grain mustard and lemons. Cooking trout this way is an easy home-style preparation that is nearly foolproof and was made better by the fact that the fish had a fresh, just-out-of-the-Boise River taste even though it had been frozen for more than four months. The paired beer was a smoked ale called--un-ironically--Lil' Smokey that overpowered the fish. If I had stuck to my original plan of smoking the trout, the flavors would have balanced out better. The mustard and leeks cut through the beer just fine and with smoked trout, the pairing would have been spot on.
The final entree was an orange-stuffed goose wrapped in bacon and slow roasted over a lentil, salted wild hog and wild rice cassoulet. Whole geese have a reputation for being dry and chewy, and this goose did nothing to change that. The best part about the dish was the salt pork lentil cassoulet that baked under the goose. The flavors of the lentils, pork and goose mixed well, creating a flavorful, earthy combination. We matched this dish with a creamy, citrusy IPA called Gone Native, which complemented the orange flavors in the goose, the combination tasting like fruit and cream.
No dinner party is complete without dessert, and ours was definitely the crowd favorite. We paired an unsweetened chocolate and raspberry stout called Mandrill with a homemade huckleberry ice-cream, chocolate crispy rice treats and candied wild hog prosciutto. Something about the candied, salty wild pig mixed exceptionally well with the tart cocoa of the beer.
When the dishes were done and the guests had gone home, I went back to my almost empty freezer for a second helping of ice cream. I spied chicken strips, wontons and frozen vegetables in the freezer's dark recesses.
Then it came to me: I like having a freezer full of game, and I still have time left in the season to fill it again. Watch out geese (and wife: watch your feet). Here I come.

description.hltext_display: 许还幻版“东方不败”亮相 跨年晚会展不俗歌喉
description.author: www.qq.com
description.content:
许还幻版“东方不败”
群星玩穿越
昨天，许还幻现身北京参与安徽卫视“爱传万家欢乐嘉年华”跨年晚会的录制。录制现场许还幻除了一展歌喉演唱了《东方不败之风云再起》经典主题曲《笑红尘》之外，还穿越时空当上“东方不败”，与王丽坤饰演的许仙和曹曦文饰演的白娘子、以及杨过小龙女（于小彤高洋饰）等一起把酒高歌，共贺新年。
许还幻自出道以来曾主演影视作品无数，但难得见其一展歌喉，在昨天的跨年晚会录制现场，许还幻以一身侠气十足的“东方不败”造型亮相，首次登台献唱了古典风韵十足的《笑红尘》，引得现场掌声不断。之后在节目组的安排下，许还幻饰演的“东方不败”与许仙、白娘子、杨过、小龙女等“偶遇”2011，大家欢聚一堂把酒当歌，上演了一处真正的大团圆。
许还幻版的“东方不败”无论是气势还是神韵都获得大家的一致好评，采访中许还幻笑言：自己对“东方不败”这一名角膜拜已久，今日终于能如愿尝试，更期待作品重拍时自己有机会参演。

description.hltext_display: Cyber Criminals Target Smartphones
description.content:
The world leader in mobile security, AdaptiveMobile, has said that year 2010 recorded the highest ever number of mobile malware infections aimed at Smartphone users, with the number of reports up 33 per cent on 2009 figures.
Taking a year-on-year view, malware engineered for the Google Android mobile platform rose most significantly, with a four-fold increase in the number of exploits identified throughout 2010 - although the total number of Android exploits is still at a low level relative to older platforms.
According to the report, the sharp rise came as cyber criminals shifted their focus towards those technologies and platforms that are likely to see the most widespread adoption in coming years. Such viruses put mobile subscribers at risk of monetary, privacy or data loss, often before the user even realises there is a problem.
Smartphones running Java-based applications saw the second highest increase in malware reports, up 45 per cent on 2009. Reported exploits aimed at the iPhone declined, whilst new Symbian malware also fell by 11 per cent. "WinCE-based viruses rose by seven per cent," the report said.
"With the increasing pervasiveness of Smartphone devices, 2010 has undoubtedly been the year that fraudsters have truly turned their attention to mobile platforms," said Gareth Maclachlan, Chief Operating Officer, AdaptiveMobile. "The vast majority of consumers are acutely aware of the threats that PC-based viruses, spam messages and phishing e-mails pose, but many are still unaware of the risks associated with their mobile devices.
"With Smartphone penetration reported to reach 37 per cent in Europe and 44 per cent in the US by 2012, we predict that the number of threats targeted at unsuspecting mobile users will continue to increase at an exponential rate throughout the course of 2011.
ven more significantly, the nature of the threats we are seeing will increase in sophistication. Whereas the majority of existing threats target either SMS, voice, email or web, the next year will see the emergence of the 'compound threat' - intelligent scams designed to exploit multiple phone capabilities in order to reap maximum reward for the criminals, before the user even realises they have become a victim.
"This trend towards more sophisticated attacks is set to shake up the telecoms and security markets as traditional approaches to protecting subscribers can simply no longer provide adequate protection.

event_or_fact.property: With the increasing pervasiveness of Smartphone devices, 2010 has undoubtedly been the year that fraudsters have truly turned their attention to mobile platforms

description.hltext_display: Dungeness crab season signals time to make cioppino
description.author: cmacias@sacbee.com (Chris Macias
description.content:
Patricia Padley always feels crabby this time of year. No, it's not from the winter cold or the holiday shopping rat race.
Padley is preparing to host her annual feast of cioppino, the seafood stew native to San Francisco that becomes especially popular when Dungeness crab season arrives.
Her cioppino recipe, which was passed down from Padley's 94-year-old mother, calls for four crabs, clams, shrimp and other seafood that simmers in a tomato-based broth. Once she gathers longtime friends and fresh loaves of sourdough bread, the cioppino holds the place of honor in a favorite winter tradition.
"We have the crab crackers and the bibs, and it's just a festive occasion," said Padley, a retired teacher who lives in Land Park. "It's a cozy meal, and you're using your hands a lot. You're peeling shrimp, you're cracking crab, and the smell is warm and friendly. You have all five senses really involved."
The fishy folklore behind cioppino starts in San Francisco around the turn of the 20th century. Italian fishermen developed the dish as a catch-of-the day kind of stew. That meant using a variety of seafoods, from crab and clams to halibut and cod.
The name "cioppino" likely derives from the Italian fish stew called cioppin. However, a legend on the website for Cioppino's restaurant in San Francisco claims the name originated from broken English of "chip in," a call from fisherman asking for contributions to a collective stew.
No matter the origin of the name, you'll find plenty of pots simmering with cioppino during Dungeness crab season. The first round of the Dungeness crab harvest starts in early November along California's Central Coast. A second rush starts in December in the Pacific Ocean waters north of Fort Bragg to Washington state.
At Pacific Seafood in Natomas, the wholesale company processes thousands of pounds of crab during the season, said manager Marty Martinez.
"The San Francisco opening was good, but the December opening was postponed a little over a week," said Martinez. "It's been a decent season."
Some of that crab has already wound up in Greg Acuna's pot of cioppino. For the past 20 years, he's cooked a Mendocino-style cioppino from a recipe he learned while growing up on California's northern coast.
Acuna's recipe calls for two Dungeness crabs, along with cod and other seafood, with a variety of saut�ed vegetables and other ingredients in a tomato sauce. He considers chardonnay a key ingredient, preferably a minimally oaked chardonnay from the Carneros appellation. (Buena Vista and Beaulieu Vineyard are his favorites for cioppino.)
"The recipe's a little Italian and a little Californian," said Acuna, an airline pilot and author who lives in Roseville. "It's a very simple recipe, but it has a lot of flavor. It's a one-pot deal that's a good, hot meal on a cold and wet night."
Along with all that crabby goodness, a fresh loaf of sourdough bread is a must for sopping up all the fish stew. Padley also recommends pairing the cioppino with some fresh citrus.
"It's very refreshing to have some kind of citrus, either sliced oranges or mandarins," said Padley. "The citrus helps break up some of the richness from the sauce."
And now it's time to think about rounding up some crabs and those longtime friends for the yearly cioppino party.
"As the cioppino steams, there's a strong but beckoning fragrance," said Padley. "We love it. It's our annual gathering of friendship and food."

event_or_fact.property: The San Francisco opening was good, but the December opening was postponed a little over a week; It's been a decent season.
The recipe's a little Italian and a little Californian; It's a very simple recipe, but it has a lot of flavor. It's a one-pot deal that's a good, hot meal on a cold and wet night.

We have the crab crackers and the bibs, and it's just a festive occasion; It's a cozy meal, and you're using your hands a lot. You're peeling shrimp, you're cracking crab, and the smell is warm and friendly. You have all five senses really involved.

description.hltext_display: Cards narrowly win Beef 'O' Brady's Bowl
description.content:
Burke tossed scoring passes to 11 yards to Cameron Graham and 10 yards to Josh Chichester while the Cardinals (7-6) erased a 14-point first-half deficit, then produced a go-ahead field goal in the fourth quarter.
Austin Davis threw 205 yards and two touchdowns to become Southern Mississippi�s career TD pass leader, moving ahead of Brett Favre and Lee Roberts in the Golden Eagles record book with 53 in three seasons.
The Southern Miss quarterback also scored on a 17-yard reception from receiver Quentin Pierce. Wright�s long kickoff return made it 28-all early in the fourth quarter. Chris Philpott�s 36-yard field goal gave the Cardinals their first lead with 6:30 remaining. Austin Pettis and his teammates say all the right things, if only because they have no other choice. No need to disrespect Utah or the early bowl game in this gambling city, even if they would rather be smelling roses somewhere else.
What might have been for Boise State ended with two missed field goals against Nevada that cost the Broncos an expected bid to the Rose Bowl.
Now they must overcome crushed expectations and perform like a BCS team against the No. 20 Utes in the MAACO Bowl in Las Vegas tonight to try and set the stage for another magical run next season.
A big win over Utah (10-2), which has won nine straight bowl games, could go a long way toward retaining the national respect Boise State has built up and set the Broncos up for a higher ranking entering the 2011 season. �I do feel pressure to finish this season off with a win,� Boise State coach Chris Petersen said. �I think it�s really important to finish this season off like we want to.�

description.content: ［Goal.com］ アトレティコ・マドリーからの関心が伝えられていたシャルケＭＦイバン・ラキティッチ。同選手は、アトレティコからの関心を喜んでいると認めている。「アトレティコでプレーしたいか？ もちろん。ヨーロッパ最高のクラブの一つだし、選手はアトレティコのようなチームでプレーすることを望む。ファンタスティックなクラブだし、街も素晴らしい。最高のファンもいる。どんなフットボーラーでも、アトレティコのようなクラブからの関心を光栄に思うはずだよ」とラキティッチは、スペイン『アス』に語った。

description.hltext_display: Romo told his season is over
description.content:
Romo went on injured reserve Tuesday, eliminating any chance of his playing Saturday night at Arizona or in the season finale at Philadelphia. He has been out since breaking his left collarbone Oct. 25. �When you just start doing the math on it and say, �Where is he with this injury? Where is he physically functioning? Where is he being able to take a hit? And then, how much practice time you need to have any player be ready to play in a game?� �interim coach Jason Garrett said. �We just felt when we factored all those things together, it just made sense to make this move.� It seemed silly for the Cowboys to take any chances since they can�t make the playoffs and are guaranteed a losing record, though they kept the option open by carrying him on the active roster the last eight weeks. Garrett said having this weekend as a target for a return helped Romo with his recovery.
Jon Kitna will start the final two games. Garrett said he wouldn�t use second-year backup Stephen McGee unless Kitna is hurt. Donovan McNabb felt disrespected by the way he was benched by Washington coach Mike Shanahan. �Everything was handled awkwardly,� McNabb said Tuesday on his weekly radio show on ESPN 980, �somewhat to a disrespect to me and to the team.� McNabb said he has a bigger problem with the way he says the organization leaked the news to the media before informing him. Cincinnati placed Terrell Owens on season-ending injured reserve a day after the receiver had surgery to repair cartilage in his left knee. � Cleveland placed linebacker Scott Fujita and cornerback Eric Wright on injured reserve. � Oakland signed former UFL punter Danny Baugher to its practice squad as insurance if Shane Lechler is unable to play this week. � Denver�s Kevin Alexander pleaded not guilty to charges stemming from an allegation of domestic violence. � Coach Mike Tomlin conceded that Pittsburgh was mistakenly awarded a first down on a 9-yard run by Rashard Mendenhall during their loss to the Jets on Sunday. � San Francisco coach Mike Singletary is keeping mum on whether Alex Smith or Troy Smith will start at quarterback.

description.hltext_display: Beebe rolls past Vilonia for Brier title
Cooking party brings chefs, gadgets together
description.author: darrington@sacbee.com (Debbie Arrington
description.content:
The Pampered Chef is Tupperware for foodies. Instead of burping lids, potential customers get together to socialize, shop � and cook. Now turning 30, the home-party company continues to draw cooks to gadgets and better (and often faster) ways to feed families.
"We have a party and do a recipe," said Christina Schulz of Auburn, a longtime Pampered Chef associate (the title given to party organizers). "Through the vehicle of the recipe, we try out different products.
"It's a girl's best kind of get-together. We eat and shop � what's better than that?"
Schulz, a fourth-grade teacher and mom, got hooked on Pampered Chef almost 10 years ago. At a party, she bought a fluted cake pan that came with a 10-minute recipe.
"I was already selling it � I was raving about it so much to my friends," she recalled. "So then I decided to sell the products part time. It was the best decision I ever made."
Her favorite products: the deep covered stoneware baker, the grill pan and the 12-inch skillet. "I use them multiple times a week," she said. "You can make dinner in under 30 minutes; that's why they're so popular."
Pampered Chef's chief selling point is saving time and money. "Pampered" partygoers tackle three to five recipes, such as green, white and red lasagna (pretty for Christmas potlucks or any time) or chicken piccata pasta. They make enough to freeze for future dinners.
"Pampered Chef is very mindful of the economy," Schulz said. "Most of our meal suggestions average $2 per serving."
For her own family, Schulz does a lot of this kind of "power cooking."
"We do 15-minute meals," she explained. "That's faster than fast food. � People really want to eat at home more. When the economy is good, people can afford to eat out more often. But you save money cooking at home."
Many Pampered Chef gadgets are designed for multiple functions. (See them at www.pamperedchef.com.) The garlic slicer also can quickly shave chocolate and slice nuts for topping holiday goodies. The apple peeler-corer also works on potatoes. The cookie press doubles as a ricer to mash potatoes in no time.
During the holidays, Pampered Chef cooks turn their attention and gadgets to making the most of leftovers.
"Nobody wants to cook after preparing a big holiday meal, but eating turkey sandwiches gets old quickly," said Karen Doherty, senior manager of recipe development at The Pampered Chef. "With a few simple tips, you can reinvent those lingering holiday staples � cranberry relish, pumpkin and even mashed potatoes � and get your everyday kitchen tools to do more of the prep work."
Some suggestions: Freeze leftover pumpkin or squash in half-cup portions for use in muffins or waffles. Bake leftover mashed potatoes into a frittata for breakfast. Use cranberry relish on peanut butter sandwiches.
Schulz, who hosts parties at her own home as well as organizing for others, also comes up with recipe ideas with her customers, who are eager to learn. "From college age to grandmas, everybody is cooking again," she said.

description.hltext_display: Уолл-стрит неудержимо рвётся вверх
description.content:
Фондовые торги в США закрылись 21 декабря 2010г. ростом сводных индикаторов. Положительная динамика котировок и повышенная активность трейдеров объясняются тем, что с каждым днем на рынке все больше растет доверие к будущему американской экономики. Эксперты отмечают, что рост прибылей компаний, оптимистичные корпоративные прогнозы по дальнейшему укреплению бизнеса, а также общая ситуация в американской экономике служат позитивными сигналами для игроков.
Вместе тем многие аналитики сходятся во мнении, что многострадальная Европа с ее долговыми проблемами больше не подкинет неприятных сюрпризов, что также придает уверенности в завтрашнем дне, пишет quote.rbc.
Информационный фон благоприятно сказался на динамике котировок американских банков. К закрытию торговых площадок ценные бумаги крупнейшего в США Bank of America Corp. успели подорожать на 2,85%, а финансовой корпорации Citigroup Inc. и банка Wells Fargo & Co. - на 0,64% и 2,39% соответственно. Выше рынка торговались акции банков Morgan Stanley и J.P.Morgan Chase, прибавившие в цене по итогам сессии 2,28% и 2,63% соответственно, а также оператора кредитных карт American Express (+1,72%).
Не обошли стороной участники рынка и новость о том, что канадская банковская группа Toronto-Dominion Bank Group (TD Bank) покупает у частного инвестфонда Cerberus Capital Management бывшее подразделение американского автоконцерна Chrysler Group LLC - Chrysler Financial, специализирующееся на предоставлении финансовых услуг в автомобильной отрасли, за 6,3 млрд долл. Трейдеры восприняли данную новость с оптимизмом, в результате чего акции TD Bank, торгующиеся в Нью-Йорке, подорожали на 3,74%.
В "плюсе" закрылись акции американских горнодобытчиков, чему послужил рост цен на золото. Эксперты уже отмечают, что в 2010г. металл подорожал на 27%, а в декабре цена за тройскую унцию достигала даже рекордных 1431,25 долл., после чего последовала некоторая коррекция. Между тем прошедшие торги подняли цены на золото до уровня в 1390 долл./унция и, как ожидается, в ближайшие два месяца ситуация коренным образом не изменится. Однако сам факт такого стремительного роста цен за последние месяцы наталкивает аналитиков на мысль о возможном надувании "золотого" пузыря.
Тем не менее, пока подобные паникерские настроения не имеют широкого распространения, и всякий рост цен на металлы приводит к росту котировок представителей данного сектора. В частности, ценные бумаги алюминиевого гиганта Alcoa Inc. и медедобывающей Freeport-McMoRan Copper & Gold Inc. подорожали на 0,8% и 1,9% соответственно, а бумаги крупнейших в стране сталелитейных компаний U.S.Steel Corp. и AK Steel Holding - на 1,74% и 3,55%. Прибавили в цене бумаги крупнейшего в мире производителя землеройного оборудования Caterpillar, подорожав на 1,43%.
Подорожали бумаги горнодобывающей компании Alpha Natural Resources (+2,78%), которая занимается в основном разработкой угля в Аппалачах - горном массиве на востоке Северной Америки. Росту котировок послужили слухи о том, что Alpha Natural собирается поглотить своего американского конкурента Massey Energy (+0,78%).
Успешной оказалась сессия для нефтяных компаний Нового Света, чему послужило повышение цен на американскую легкую нефть на срочной товарной бирже в Нью-Йорке до 89,82 долл./барр. В результате котировки нефтяных гигантов ExxonMobil и ConocoPhillips подросли на 0,7% и 0,97%, а их конкурентов - Chevron и Marathon Oil - на 0,5% и 0,8% соответственно. В положительном направлении двигались котировки нефтесервисных предприятий Schlumberger и Halliburton, чьи акции закрылись в плюсе на 0,32% и 0,35%.
Ростом котировок закончился торговый день для американского разработчика программного обеспечения Adobe Systems. Уже после закрытия торгов 20 декабря компания отчиталась о результатах за прошедший 2009-2010 финансовый год, завершившийся 3 декабря 2010г. Участникам рынка пришелся по вкусу рост чистой прибыли более чем вдвое - до 774,68 млн долл., а также значительный рост выручки - до 3,8 млрд долл. Вместе с тем прогноз компании на будущие периоды послужил инвесторам не меньшим сигналом для покупок, что привело к росту котировок акций Adobe Systems более чем на 6%.
По итогам торгов индекс "голубых фишек" Dow Jones увеличился на 55,03 пункта (+0,48%) - до 11533,20 пункта, индекс "широкого рынка" S&P - на 7,52 пункта (+0,60%) - до 1254,60 пункта, высокотехнологичный NASDAQ - на 18,05 пункта (+0,68%) - до 2667,61 пункта.

description.hltext_display: Европа дружно растёт
description.content:
Основные европейские фондовых индексы(17 из 18) выросли вчера на фоне ослабления напряженности на Корейском полуострове.
Кроме того, как отмечает агентство Bloomberg, инвесторов вдохновило заявление КНР о принятии конкретных мер для поддержки еврозоны в решении долговых проблем.
Сводный индекс крупнейших предприятий региона Stoxx Europe 600 поднялся по итогам торгов на 1% - до 281,11 пункта, преодолев отметку в 280,41 пункта, зафиксированную по итогам сессии, предшествовавшей объявлению о банкротстве Lehman Brothers. С начала декабря индикатор поднялся на 7,4%, передаёт finmarket.ru
Индекс крупнейших предприятий Европы Dow Jones Euro Stoxx 50 вырос на 37,77 пункт (+1,33%) - до 2876?99 пункта.
Британский FTSE 100 увеличился 60,19 пункта (+1,02%) и составил 5951,80 пункта.
Французский индекс CAC 40 повысился на 42,41 пункта (+1,09%) - до 3927,49 пункта.
Германский DAX прибавил на 59,39 пункта (+0,85%) и составил 7077,99 пункта.
Индексы выросли на всех 18 фондовых площадках Западной Европы за исключением Люксембурга.
Акции горнодобывающих компаний поднялись на фоне подъема стоимости меди до очередного рекорда - $9325,25 за тонну. Цена бумаг BHP Billiton подскочила на 2,9%, Rio Tinto - на 2,6%.
Стоимость бумаг нидерландской Royal DSM, крупнейшего в мире производителя витаминов, выросла на 3,9% после того, как компания сообщила о покупке американской Martek Biosciences Corp., специализирующейся на ингредиентах для детского питания, за $1,09 млрд.

description.hltext_display: Снижение запасов толкнуло нефтяной рынок вверх
description.content:
Цены на нефть выросли в среду почти до $90 за баррель благодаря данным о резком уменьшении запасов в США на прошлой неделе и похолоданию в США и Европе.
К 9.11 февральские фьючерсы на американскую легкую нефть поднялись на $0,16 до $90,05. Фьючерсы на нефть сорта Brent прибавили $0,3 до $93,52.
Американский институт нефти сообщил во вторник, что запасы нефти в США упали на 5,8 миллиона баррелей, хотя аналитики ждали гораздо более скромного снижения.
"Значительное снижение запасов нефти и бензина подтолкнуло рынок вверх. Но покупательский интерес на этом уровне - около $90 за баррель - не так велик", - сказал Кен Хасегава из Newedge brokerage.
Управление энергетической информации США опубликует официальные данные о запасах сегодня в 17.30.
Холодная зима на севере Европы и в США также пошла на пользу нефти, поскольку спрос на топливо увеличился. Ожидается, что спрос на печное топливо в США на этой неделе будет примерно на 4,6 процента выше нормы.
Небольшие объемы торгов также поддерживают цены.
"Перед долгими рождественскими каникулами на рынке сравнительно мало участников. Поэтому есть возможность продолжения ночного роста на низких объемах. Но я не думаю, что рынок настолько оптимистичен", - сказал Хасегава, пишет Reuters.

description.hltext_display: Oregon's Kelly edges Chizik for top coach
description.author: Anne M. Peterson
description.content:
In just his second season leading Oregon, Kelly is taking the second-ranked Ducks to the national championship game Jan. 10 against No. 1 Auburn ? and for that he was voted AP Coach of the Year on Tuesday.
Kelly received 24 votes from the 60-member AP football poll panel to beat out his BCS title game counterpart, Gene Chizik of Auburn, who received 17 votes. Stanford�s Jim Harbaugh was third with five votes, TCU�s Gary Patterson, last year�s winner, and Mark Dantonio of Michigan State each received three votes. Getting one vote apiece were Nevada�s Chris Ault, Oklahoma State�s Mike Gundy and Miami of Ohio�s Mike Haywood, who led the school to a Mid-American Conference championship before taking the top job at Pittsburgh last week.
Mike Bellotti, Oregon�s longtime head coach through the 2008 season, hired Kelly away from New Hampshire to run the Ducks� offense in 2007. He installed an up-tempo, spread-option attack that has been growing more potent ever since. It didn�t take long for it to become clear that Bellotti had hired his heir apparent. When Bellotti was tapped to take over as the school�s athletic director, Oregon announced in December 2008 ? as the Ducks prepared for the Holiday Bowl ? that Bellotti would become full-time AD at some point and Kelly was the head coach in waiting.
That spring, Bellotti made it official and Kelly took over the Ducks. In his first season as head coach, Kelly led the Ducks to a 10-3 record and the Pac-10 championship, tailoring his explosive offense to the dual talents of quarterback Jeremiah Masoli.
Oregon went on to the Rose Bowl for the first time since New Year�s 1995. Kelly was met by more turbulence this past spring when both Masoli and running back LaMichael James got into trouble.
Kelly had his team focused on moving forward in fall camp. The ability to rein in his team and shut out distractions has become one of his trademarks. This season�s Ducks have bought into Kelly�s �Win The Day� philosophy. The motto is the last thing the players see above them as they emerge from the tunnel onto the field at Autzen Stadium.

description.hltext_display: Инвесторы посчитали евро перепроданным
description.content:
Евро к доллару продолжает расти, так как инвесторы посчитали падение единой валюты за прошедшую неделю чрезмерным. Кроме того, сообщает агентство Bloomberg, евро дорожает в паре с иеной впервые за 6 сессий в ожидании позитивных статданных из Германии и Италии.
Европейская валюта растет второй день подряд, пишет finmarket.
Курс евро к 9:22 в среду повысился до $1,3129 c $1,3100 на конец торговой сессии в Нью-Йорке днем ранее.
В паре с иеной единая валюта поднялась со 109,71 до 110,03 иены. За предыдущие пять сессий евро подешевел к иене на 2%.
Доллар не изменился и стоил 83,7 иены.

description.hltext_display: Potty Training Power offers Holiday Support for Parents
description.content:
Potty Training Power is ready to offer support to the thousands of parents who will be taking advantage of the winter holidays to teach their toddlers how to use the toilet and tips and encouragement for those whose children have regressed because of the excitement and busy nature of the season. The web based system offers parents practical advice and personalized support to get them over the common hurdles of potty training.
The founders of Potty Training Power, Sean and Cindy Platt, have helped hundreds of parents teach their children to use the potty and to deal with common problems such as accidents and potty training regression. Busy times like the holidays are ripe for bathroom related mishaps as children experience changes in their schedules and lots of extra stimulation.
The Platt’s advice is simple: deal with potty training accidents in a calm, matter of fact manner and continue to enforce firm, loving boundaries. Be mindful of how many activities you are scheduling for your young child and never be afraid to scale back and instead spend some quiet, cozy family time instead.
Pressure from friends and family can make the situation worse, so parents will need to learn to tune out well-meaning but backwards advice and criticism and focus on what is best for themselves and their children.
The holidays are a magical time for young toddlers and preschoolers and parents should enjoy every minute of it, instead of stressing out about minor accidents. Keep things in perspective, take some breaths and remember that all things will pass.
Potty Training Power was founded in 2009 by Sean and Cindy Platt to help parents turn potty training time into a time of bonding between parents and children instead of a stressful time of tantrums and tears. The former preschool teachers have helped hundreds of parents teach their children to use the toilet using techniques that focus on the needs of each child as an individual.
CONTACT INFORMATION
Tracy O'Connor
Potty Training Power

description.hltext_display: Razorbacks refocus on protecting ball
Sears Canada says Driscoll to succeed Ravas as CFO
description.content:
NEW YORK (Reuters) - Retailer Sears Canada Inc named Sharon Driscoll on Tuesday as its new finance chief to replace CFO Allen Ravas, who is returning to Sears Holdings to work at a California subsidiary.
Driscoll has served as a senior vice president of finance since November 2008. Ravas, CFO since October of that year, will serve as the Chief Administrative Officer of Orchard Supply Hardware of San Jose, California.
Sears Canada, 90 percent owned by Sears Holdings, owns a network of 196 corporate stores, 260 dealer stores and 33 home improvement showrooms. Last month it reported a 61 percent drop in third-quarter profit, results its CEO called "disappointing."
Sears Canada's shares closed at C$19.14 on Tuesday on the Toronto Stock Exchange.
(Reporting by Nick Zieminski; Editing by Muralikumar Anantharaman)

description.hltext_display: Wine Buzz: This Lodi zinfandel serves as a souvenir of hard work
description.author: cmacias@sacbee.com (Chris Macias
description.content:
Just thinking about that day picking grapes makes my back stiff.
It was the end of the 2008 harvest, and I'd joined a crew of farmworkers to help pick 10 tons of zinfandel near Lodi. Seeing and feeling the grape harvest, I figured, would make for a compelling story about the labor that goes into wine.
But my motivations were also personal. My parents and extended family grew up picking table grapes and other crops around the Central Valley. I was the fortunate son raised in the suburbs, never knowing the blade of a harvesting knife or the hours of work crouched in the dirt. Writing this story was a way of honoring my parents and trying, even if only for a day, to get a sense of my family's peasant past.
Trudging through the vineyards for 10 hot hours, I wondered how the wine would taste when released two years later.
Now, on a recent stormy Sunday, a bottle of 2008 Barsetti Lodi Zinfandel stands before me. The label bears a scene of flush grapevines and a glowing sunrise on the horizon. It almost looks like the sky when work started at 7 that October morning, the beginning of a day when I'd never been dirtier or more thankful for a desk job with air conditioning.
Janis Barsetti of Barsetti Vineyards tells me this zinfandel won a gold medal recently at the Riverbank Wine & Cheese Exposition. Granted, the competition wasn't so fierce at this small festival, with such supermarket brands as Turning Leaf and Barefoot nabbing golds in other categories. Still, it's a nice nod, and I joke with my friends that my grape-picking has a golden touch.
The truth is, my work that day represents a tiny drop of the wine in front of me. I marveled at the speed and sheer work ethic of the workers around me. I just hoped I wasn't getting in the way. Too often, some of my grape clusters ended up on the ground. By early afternoon, I was fading fast.
I'm remembering all this as I pour a glass. The wine is dark purple, but at first sniff, it isn't giving up much in the nose. Then some spice emerges and a little alcohol heat. I'm expecting a typical Lodi fruit bomb, but I'm struck by the wine's moderate weight. It's actually drinking pretty well with its dark fruit flavors and pronounced acidity. This story that started two years ago is finally complete.
I think about my mom and dad, and everyone else in my family who toiled in the fields to make a better life for the rest of us. To them, I take another sip and humbly say, "Salud."

event_or_fact.property: won a gold medal recently at the Riverbank Wine&Cheese Exposition

description.hltext_display: Ett halvt sekel med korv och mos
description.content:
Mat på Öster. Korv med bröd är en del av den svenska kulturen, anser Lars-Göran Nilsson, till vänster, och Morgan Deile.
Renoverat. Menyn har utökats sedan starten. Dock serveras ingen pizza. Morgan Deile, till vänster, och Lars-Göran Nilsson.
Ett bandyutkast från Vinterstadion, ligger matstället dit folk vallfärdat i ett halvt sekel.
Korvmojen Deiles har under åren haft besök av vanliga knegare, pendlare, hemvändande och vingliga kroggäster, Agnetha Fältskog och kungahuset.
Nej, vi ska egentligen inte skriva Vinterstadion utan Behrn arena, och inte korvmoj utan snabbmatsrestaurang. När Deiles startade var inte ens bandy-och ishockeyarenorna byggda. Namn har ändrats uti staden Örebro, så en del örebroare känner sig måhända vilsna, men Deiles har i 50 år hetat Deiles även om näringsstället förändrat form och plats. I denna decembermånad firas jubileet. – Utvecklingen har hela tiden varit en viktig del av Deiles historia. Därför har vi kunnat behålla våra matgäster, och locka nya. Det är kul att föra traditionen vidare och samtidigt se framåt, säger nuvarande ägaren Lars-Göran Nilsson.
På Deiles kan man inte bara få korv, mos och bröd – om någon trodde det. Menyn har utökats, dock kan man inte få pizza.
Snabbmatsstället har nyligen fått ny kostym. Matgästerna intar sina måltider i en ljus miljö, präglad av glas, sten och trä.
Annat var det förr, 1960, då Morgan Deile började jobba ihop med sin pappa Lars. Då var Deiles en enkel korvkiosk intill järnvägen vid Norrköpingsvägen.
Morgan sålde Deiles till Lars-Göran Nilsson år 2000. – När pappa och jag började fanns vi i utkanten av stan. Mamma Hildur, som gjorde mycket, lade bland annat in skivgurka och så tillverkade hon stark senap.
I boken ”Första mosboken” har han skildrat sina minnen som korvgubbe. Jo, det är korvgubbe han kallar sig – och han gör det med stolthet.
Morgan, som numera bor i Karlskoga och är pensionär, har mycket att berätta. En gång på tidigt 60-tal kom en stor svart bil med registreringsnumret A 1.En chaufför klev ur bilen och beställde några korvar. – Han lämnade korvarna till dem som satt i bilen, jag såg inte vilka de var, men jag förstår att de var från kungahuset eftersom bilen hade skylten A1. Så därför kan jag kalla mig kunglig hov–leverantör. – En annan gång knackade en gravid Agnetha Fältskog på dörren och ville låna toan. Det var sent. Resten av gänget som då kallade sig Fästfolket, inte Abba, satt i turnébussen, säger Morgan.
Han har förutom Agnetha Fältskog mött massor av korv-och mossugna kändisar, men framför allt har han mött, snackat med och serverat generationer av örebroare.
Hans efterträdare Lars-Göran Nilsson vill fortsätta i samma anda även om ”LG” mest säljer hamburgare.

description.hltext_display: Sibal covering up 2G scam: BJP
description.content:
Tags: Kapil Sibal, 2G scam, BJP
Share
Translate into:
New Delhi: Dismissing Telecom Minister Kapil Sibal's charge that the NDA government lost Rs 1.43 lakh crore in revenue because of its policies, BJP on Wednesday said the minister was "defending the indefensible" in the 2G spectrum scam.
"It is a worst kind of cover up," BJP spokesman Prakash Javdekar said reacting to Sibal's claim.
Sibal had yesterday claimed that the government "actually" lost Rs 1.43 lakh crore in revenue in 1999 due to the then BJP-led NDA regime shifting to revenue share system from fixed licence fee for telecom operations.
Javdekar said NDA government's "pragmatic policies" and revenue sharing model "unleashed a revolution" in the telecom sector and "it did not allow the sector to die".
It is evident from the "teledensity" in the country today, he said.
Criticising the minister for comparing it to the present telecom policy, he said, "You are selling the spectrum in 2008 at the rate of 2001 and how you want to justify any how is all bad advocacy...what was right in 2001 will not be right in 2008."
Sibal's comment come at a time when the government auditor CAG has quantified a "presumptive" revenue loss of Rs 1.76 lakh crore due to non-auction of 2G spectrum in 2008 by former Telecom Minister A Raja.

event_or_fact.property: It is evident from the "teledensity" in the country today
NDA government's "pragmatic policies" and revenue sharing model "unleashed a revolution" in the telecom sector and "it did not allow the sector to die"
the government "actually" lost Rs 1.43 lakh crore in revenue in 1999 due to the then BJP-led NDA regime shifting to revenue share system from fixed licence fee for telecom operations.
It is a worst kind of cover up
You are selling the spectrum in 2008 at the rate of 2001 and how you want to justify any how is all bad advocacy...what was right in 2001 will not be right in 2008.

description.hltext_display: オランダ代表ＭＦ：「ヴォルフスブルクが興味を持ってくれている」
description.content: ［Goal.com］ トゥエンテＭＦテオ・ヤンセンは、自身にヴォルフスブルクが関心を抱いていることを認めた。ただ１月の移籍市場で新天地を求めることはないと考えている。「（ヴォルフスブルクからの）関心は知っている。だがそれは公式なものじゃない」と２９歳のオランダ代表ＭＦは、『ＴＣＴｕｂａｎｔａ』に語った。「それは（スティーブ・マクラーレン）監督がウィンターブレイクの後も指揮を執り続けるかどうかだ。そのことについて何も知らないし、待たなければいけない」「でもオレは何も知らないんだ。すぐに代理人のロブ・ヤンセンと話をするだろう。彼がどうなっているか教えてくれるはずだ」「ただ、ウィンターブレイクの後もここに残っている可能性は７０パーセントあると言わせてもらうよ」ヤンセンにはヴォルフスブルクのほかにも、リヴァプールが関心を抱いていると伝えられている。

description.hltext_display: Blow to Lingerie Industry as UK TV Coverage for American Lingerie Football League is Delayed
description.content:
2011 is looking bleak for manufacturers and retailers of lingerie. As a luxury that many people no longer consider affordable, lingerie and bridal lingerie sales have dropped off in 2010 and the boost that the British lingerie industry was relying on to boost sales now looks set to be delayed even further. In a move that is also sure to make men all over the British Isles hugely disappointed, it has been announced that UK audiences may be forced to wait a while longer to see scantily clad female American football players take to their TV screens on a regular basis.
Despite suggesting that there are plans in place to franchise the American based Lingerie Football League in Europe and Asia in early 2010, there is still no word from founder Mitchell S. "Mitch" Mortaza as to when the girls and their lingerie will appear on this side of the Atlantic. This is sure to depress the retailers that had been anticipating a boost in lingerie sales as a result of the launch of a European league.
As yet, the Lingerie Football League is not even available to watch on UK TV and so has not had the same positive impact on the British bridal lingerie retailers that it has had on their American counterparts. Screened on US channel MTV2, the bridal lingerie clad ladies have attracted high viewing figures in the United States but the games have not been syndicated on British TV.
The highly controversial Lingerie Football League, or LFL as it is commonly known, has made a major splash in the United States since the start of its inaugural season in 2009. It has caused major controversy amongst women’s groups, which branded it sexist and demeaning, and causing just as much furore amongst the male population, towards whom it is marketed, but more as a result of the bridal lingerie style attire.
Ronan Carr, CEO of Irish lingerie website Linger.ie, has certainly felt the disappointment that has filtered through the industry on account of the lack of news: "We live in desperate economic times right now and every industry seems to be suffering, including the lingerie business," he said. "I was really looking forward to the welcome boost that the Lingerie Football League would bring, especially considering sales rose astronomically in the US. The industry could really do with an announcement like this sooner rather than later."
Considering the attention it has attracted and the sheer volume of individuals watching the ladies in lingerie play American football online, it is inevitable that the LFL will expand to incorporate leagues in Europe and Asia. However, when that will happen is certainly a major question that Mortaza will have to address sooner rather than later if the league is to stand any chance of success in the United Kingdom. Furthermore, it is a question that lingerie companies like Linger.ie would like an answer to in order to provide a little profitability in dark economic times.

description.hltext_display: Futura invests in new service centre for tissue converters in Alpharetta, GA
description.content:
LUCCA, Italy , Dec. 22, 2010 (Press Release) - Futura North America has asserted its commitment to America's tissue converters by investing in a considerably larger service centre in Alpharetta, Georgia. The company moved to its new premises in early December.

description.hltext_display: Holmen signs electricity supply agreement with Vattenfall in Sweden
description.content:
STOCKHOLM , Dec. 22, 2010 (Press Release) - Holmen has reached a new long-term electricity supply agreement with Vattenfall. The agreement means that Holmen will purchase some 0.9 TWh of electricity per year from Vattenfall - almost a third of the purchased electricity that Holmen needs - for a six-year period beginning in 2016.

description.hltext_display: Azzi's Dons still finding the way in her 1st year
description.content:
This photo made Dec. 17, 2010, shows San Francisco women's basketball coach Jennifer Azzi posing on the campus in San Francisco, Friday, Dec. 17, 2010. The 42-year-old Azzi could have coached many times over the years at various levels, but it never felt right _ until now, right at home in the Bay Area for a school that needed her help. Photo: Jeff Chiu / AP
This photo made Dec. 17, 2010, shows San Francisco women's...
This photo made Dec. 17, 2010, shows San Francisco women's basketball coach Jennifer Azzi posing on the campus in San Francisco, Friday, Dec. 17, 2010. The 42-year-old Azzi could have coached many times over the years at various levels, but it never felt right _ until now, right at home in the Bay Area for a school that needed her help. Photo: Jeff Chiu / AP
This photo made Dec. 17, 2010, shows San Francisco women's...
This photo made Dec. 17, 2010, shows San Francisco women's basketball coach Jennifer Azzi posing on the campus in San Francisco, Friday, Dec. 17, 2010. The 42-year-old Azzi could have coached many times over the years at various levels, but it never felt right _ until now, right at home in the Bay Area for a school that needed her help. Photo: Jeff Chiu / AP
This photo made Dec. 17, 2010, shows San Francisco women's...
Larger | Smaller
Georgia (default)
Verdana
Times New Roman
Arial
MORE SPORTS
Page 1 of 1
SAN FRANCISCO (AP) â€” Jennifer Azzi is quick to point out that as a first-year college coach she never would have scheduled Stanford, her alma mater, to play at San Francisco. That one was already on the calendar when she took the job back in April.
Still, she acknowledges the intrigue: Azzi and USF assistant Katy Steding facing former coach Tara VanDerveer and the eighth-ranked Cardinal on Wednesday night â€” with VanDerveer making her third attempt at 800 wins against Azzi's 2-9 Dons.
"I'm thrilled, though," Azzi said. "It's great for them to have the exposure. We'll get a great crowd. I don't think many first-year coaches would schedule the (No. 8) team in the country."
And not many mid-major schools with a long tradition of losing have someone with Azzi's Hall of Fame basketball pedigree running their program, either. She and Steding helped lead the VanDerveer-coached 1996 national team to Olympic gold in Atlanta and also brought Stanford an NCAA title in 1990. Both are former WNBA stars. That doesn't mean recruiting comes easy.
The 42-year-old Azzi could have coached many times over the years at various levels, but it never felt right â€” until now, right at home in the Bay Area for a school that needed her help. She took a leap of faith, committed to turning around a struggling program that mostly goes unnoticed with all the high-profile sports teams in greater San Francisco.
"I knew that coming in, so I don't think there have been any real surprises," Azzi said, walking on the Hilltop campus one day last week. "Going elsewhere, or the WNBA or some other situations, it didn't have the same motivation for me."
There are few reminders of her own decorated career.
On the wall in her office hangs her old No. 8 WNBA jersey from the Detroit Shock, the team that selected her fifth overall in the first round of the 1999 draft. Framed on her desk is the late John Wooden's "Pyramid of Success."
"She has a team that will be much better, maybe not right away, but as she gets to put her stamp on it," VanDerveer said. "What will be fun is going to dinner afterward with her, talking to her, watching her team. I've been there and I know what she's going through. I just see it as an opportunity to see firsthand what they have. Obviously they're in a different situation than we are. I always enjoy the opportunity to spend time with Jennifer.
"It's really good for me because you realize it's the same job whether it's her first game or my 1,000th game. You're doing the same job. I still have the same excitement that she has, and the same enthusiasm. It's fun for me to see how she's going about it."
Before a recent game at Sacramento State, Azzi invited Cincinnati Reds manager Dusty Baker â€” who lives in Northern California â€” to talk to the team. His message: You don't always have to be the most talented team to win.
Last week, Azzi used a long bus ride back from Cal Poly to examine her team's 25-point loss. She can accept the defeats when her team plays hard, executes and shows improvement, but this wasn't one of those games.
The Dons are struggling heading into the daunting game with Stanford.
"I wish there was some kind of amnesia for losing games," she said. "You want to learn from it, but it doesn't have to be constant. Oh, because we lost a few games, it doesn't mean we have to lose every game."
At least Steding can be a sounding board. She spent seven years as head coach at Warner Pacific College in her native Oregon, leading the program to the NAIA tournament for the first time in school history in 2004.
"It's not like she's cut her teeth as an assistant," Steding said of Azzi. "It's not new for me, but it is new for Jen. She's learning. She has a great vision. ... It's definitely coming (here). We see signs of it."
It could take a while.
Azzi replaced Tanya Haave, who was fired after four disappointing seasons. Azzi, who had been working as a health and wellness enthusiast and motivational speaker, took over a team that has finished seventh in the eight-team West Coast Conference the past four seasons.
Haave went 36-86 overall and 12-44 in conference play during her tenure, including 5-27 overall and 1-13 in WCC play last season.
Azzi has taken all of two days off since she was hired, typically working from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. then making calls and watching film from home.
Right now, she takes joy in the little things, such as seeing one of her players run faster through better fitness or make her 3-pointers. In the end, Azzi wants the young women she coaches to be prepared for life in the world after college, after basketball.
"It's a matter of them having a mindset that they can accomplish anything. I think it will take some time," Azzi said. "When you're coaching, I can't go in the gym and work on my 3-pointer right now. You have to think long-term, and you have to think really strategically. It's not just going in the gym and working. There's so much to it, and there's also a good bit you that can't control, that is pretty challenging. As a player you can control pretty much your destiny."
Azzi sure did. She was heaving underhanded shots at age 4.
She led Stanford to its first NCAA title in '90 with a 32-1 record and earned Pac-10 Player of the Year honors, was a three-time all-conference selection and finished her college career with 1,634 points, 751 assists and 271 steals.
Azzi went on to play overseas and five seasons in the WNBA.
Being on the other side of it is different. Joanne Boyle, coach at California, told Azzi to give it 13 months before the schedule and constant demands becomes slightly more normal.
While Azzi isn't one to broadcast her remarkable basketball resume, recruits do like the idea of playing for a pair of gold medalists and former professional stars. Especially considering she has to sell a "$52,000-a-year education in the world's No. 1 city. That's kind of crazy in a way."
"I like to live in the moment and create and be thinking a lot about the future," Azzi said. "I think that's fun. Not like, 'Hey, I'm so great, I'm in the Hall of Fame.' I don't want to look at that every day. I had so many people even before I took the job here say, 'Why in the world would you take that job, take over a program that has no hope, a losing program,' all of these things because I was so successful. Well, I didn't start as that. I'm not afraid of challenges, and I really like the idea of constantly being challenged with things."

I wish there was some kind of amnesia for losing games; You want to learn from it, but it doesn't have to be constant. Oh, because we lost a few games, it doesn't mean we have to lose every game.

I knew that coming in, so I don't think there have been any real surprises; Going elsewhere, or the WNBA or some other situations, it didn't have the same motivation for me.
It's not like she's cut her teeth as an assistant; It's not new for me, but it is new for Jen. She's learning. She has a great vision. ... It's definitely coming (here). We see signs of it.
I'm thrilled, though; It's great for them to have the exposure. We'll get a great crowd. I don't think many first-year coaches would schedule the (No. 8) team in the country.

description.hltext_display: Mike Dunne's Wine of the Week: 2007 Amador County Petite Sirah
description.content:
In braces, boots and jeans � or even overalls � Charles Spinetta projects the image of a laconic farmer, going about his chores with an attitude both relaxed and distracted.
Since I first became acquainted with him many years ago, he's always seemed an unusually jovial guy for someone whose livelihood could be upset in a major way by a prolonged drought or an untimely hailstorm. His joking demeanor didn't just emerge in recent years, as he started to relinquish to his and his wife's three sons much of the responsibility for running the family's Charles Spinetta Winery in Amador County's Shenandoah Valley.
Maybe his serenity is an article of faith. Or maybe it's the acquired wisdom that comes from working the land for nearly 50 years, since he graduated in 1963 from the School of Forestry at the University of California, Berkeley.
First he felled timber, then he began to grow grapes. And his roots in Amador County's agrarian history go far deeper than even that, starting with the arrival during the Gold Rush of relatives from Italy who began to farm outside Jackson.
In any case, behind that kicked-back attitude is the mind of a shrewd businessman and the soul of an astute steward of the land.
On a visit to his rolling ranch this past fall harvest, we paused in his winery so he could scan a few of the 25 clipboards lined up in a wall rack. They were arranged as orderly as the rows of vines spreading from the winery. Clipped to every one was a form to track the activity at each of his tanks of fermenting wine. Sugar levels, pH readings, additions, rackings and miscellaneous comments for each were recorded in meticulous handwritten notes.
"It's just like a hospital, one per bed. These are our patients," Spinetta's son Jim said as he paused while monitoring gauges, moving hoses and drawing samples.
With all that precision and care, a visitor might think that Charles Spinetta could explain why one of his current releases, the Charles Spinetta Winery 2007 Amador County Petite Sirah, is so different from the usual interpretation of the varietal rendered by him and other California winemakers.
It's different largely in its approachable lushness. Comparably young petite sirah often is marked by tannins almost as solid as the stone walls of the children's castle that rise from one of the ponds on the Spinetta spread. Petite sirah's tannins can be just as protective and unyielding. The tannins of the 2007 Charles Spinetta, on the other hand, taste as if they've been stretched as thin and fine as al dente linguine.
Aside from the soft tannins, the petite sirah is a faithful representative of the varietal. Its color is inky purple, its aroma both floral and fruity, its flavor running to ripe and juicy blackberries spiced with a dash of pepper. It's a muscular and ripe petite sirah, but without any hint of raisins or heat from alcohol.
So how did he make a new petite sirah so approachable?
"I don't know," Spinetta said. "I made it the same way we do it every year. It was more the vineyard than me. Those vines are 35 years old now. And 2007 was a really nice year."
CHARLES SPINETTA WINERY 2007 AMADOR COUNTY PETITE SIRAH ($21)
By the numbers: 13.9 percent alcohol, 200 cases, $21.
Context: This is a wine with the muscle and saturation for winter stews. Spinetta especially likes it with tri-tip but wouldn't turn down a glass if it were offered over a chicken dinner.
Availability: The Jackson branch of Safeway is the only store beyond the winery where the petite sirah can be bought. It also can be ordered through the winery's website, www.charlesspinettawinery.com.
More information: Charles Spinetta Winery, 12557 Steiner Road, Plymouth, is open 9 a.m.-4 p.m. Thursday through Monday. In addition to a tasting room, the winery includes an art gallery specializing in works by wildlife artists.
